abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average rose 101.63 points, to 8,512.28, while the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index gained 15.73 points, to 919.53.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average rose 101.63 points, to 8,512.28, while the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index gained 15.73 points, to 919.53.
lead_paragraph: Some of the big banks may need billions of dollars in additional capital, but Wall Street decided Wednesday to view the glass of the financial system as half full.

headline.main: Banks Gain Ahead of Stress-Test Results
headline.print_headline: Banks Gain Ahead of Stress-Test Results
